name: SYLVAN INDUSTRIAL PIPING, INC. v. EICHLEAY CORPORATION and Wheeling Nisshin Steel Corporation. Petition of Eichleay Corporation, a Delaware Corporation
name_abbreviation: Sylvan Industrial Piping, Inc. v. Eichleay Corp.

parties: SYLVAN INDUSTRIAL PIPING, INC. v. EICHLEAY CORPORATION and Wheeling Nisshin Steel Corporation. Petition of Eichleay Corporation, a Delaware Corporation.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 25th day of August 1999, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED, limited to the following issues:
1. Whether the trial court had jurisdiction to rule on the motion for counsel fees during the pendency of an appeal?
2. Whether the Superior Court erred in ruling on the merits of the appeal without a 1925(a) statement from the trial court?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: David E. White, Pittsburgh, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
735 A.2d 1261
SYLVAN INDUSTRIAL PIPING, INC. v. EICHLEAY CORPORATION and Wheeling Nisshin Steel Corporation. Petition of Eichleay Corporation, a Delaware Corporation.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Aug. 25, 1999.
David E. White, Pittsburgh, for petitioner.
